author: @milahkay212
text:
Olay!!! You made the most obvious point that third party always forgets. We need to get third party candidates into Congress first. And strong candidates not just anyone to establish the third party's credibility
üëèüèæüëèüèæüëèüèæüëèüèæ

replies.author: @ryno4ever433
replies.text: Third party credibility is not the problem here. Third parties aren't viable due to a mathematical issue inherent to our voting system. We would need to legislate to make them viable which goes against the interests of both current parties. So it would be a long shot.

replies.author: @milahkay212
replies.text: @ryno4ever433 I agree that this is also an issue third parties face

replies.author: @mechatnkiespacecambodia
replies.text:
Congress, state, local, the whole bit. A vanguard party must be established; as Lenin said, we must use/participate in bourgeois elections as a mechanism to raise class consciousness. 

More unionization, more organizing. It's hopeful that the American populace is finally realizing not just that socialism is an inevitability, but are also realizing that it will not come through the democratic party, who are funded and controlled by the same oligarchs as Republicans

replies.author: @DavidLindes
replies.text: @ryno4ever433 but don't you see, that's exactly why Milah's (and Olay's) point is so important.  If we had significant representation by 3rd parties in local, state, and even federal legislatures, then "We would need to legislate" could have more chance of happening.  But the existing 3rd parties keep running to be the cherry on top, but nobody's making any ice cream.  We can't get a sundae that way.  We gotta get churning.

author: @NStevenHarris
text: I had warmed up to Cornel West, but this panel is uncovering the problems that the Black conscious communities in 90's NYC had with him. He would have debates with Dr. Leonard Jeffries and others and it would come up how he would have critiques for Black leaders but nothing for the White folks attacking those Black those Black leaders. I salute you all on this panel.

replies.author: @bebomac5
replies.text: No one can hurt you like those closest to you. Establishment Black leadership has done nothing for us, and lend cover for those who don‚Äôt have are best interests at heart.

replies.author: @jayrose8869
replies.text: Why black folks never want to solve our problems instead of saying but they did it too. üßê

replies.author: @robertnicholls9917
@robertnicholls9917
replies.text:
@yaobikuni1349 Everything you wrote, I can tell, came from watching hours on end of CNN, MSNBC or CBS and ABC. It's all just establishment lies that many of you keep falling for.

These propagandist normalize horrible Republican ideas that Corporate Dems sell you, like endless wars and tax cuts for the rich. They also sell the idea that Dems have no power, whether they have a 58-60 seat majority in the Senate or 50-52 seats.

These Corporate Dems help privatize public schools and cut housing funding like BLACK mayor Adams. It's a black Corporate Dem in Atlanta who is trying to build Cop City and destroy the forest.

A lot of you who can't stop supporting Corporate Dems are just as cultish as MAGA. Even when Corporate Dems show you who they are; you still can't stop.

Biden just appointed one of the biggest war criminals in history, Elliot Abrams but even this information won't sway many. He has kept many of Trump's immigration policies, kept DeJoy at the post office and continues endless wars all over the globe.

West's and Bernie's politics are almost the same as MLK's and The Black Panther Party. I say almost because MLK and the Panther's were further to the left. West and Bernie are centrists.

I'm not here to sway you because there is a certain segment of us in the black community who refuse to see Corporate Dems for what they are. I think Corporate Dems are more insidious; they come with smiles while normalizing policies that hurt us the most.

I can run off a list of at least 20 horrible Republican policies they've brought over the finish line.

To each his own.

replies.author: @ShooterNumberOne
replies.text: https://youtu.be/lIZ0o-2tkhw

replies.author: @StratsRUs
replies.text: Dr West is an eejit

replies.author: @beyondaboundary6034
replies.text: @yaobikuni1349 A lot of the attacks on Bernie were also from people defending the bought and paid for corporate Democratic party, though. Yes, Bernie was/is flawed in many ways, and yes there are too many racist and sexist white male leftists out there. But there are ALSO neoliberals of all colors from Chuck Todd to Joy Ann Reid who cynically weaponized the Bernie Bro narrative to protect the billionaire class that controls both parties and is crushing workers and the poor. Let's have an honest conversation about racism and sexism on the left, but let's also talk about capitalism and imperialism among elite liberals who dismiss the left with class reductionism charges, erasing leftists of color and shutting down critiques of an evil exploitative system. I am SO sick of that shit.

author: @charlottehammond8975
text: As a white progressive who has read a lot of west's books, this was massively eye opening. Thank you so much olay

replies.author: @newchapters600
replies.text: And it‚Äôs gonna have to be a thing where now you will have to extract his recent actions and sentiments from the work that really did so much for all of us

replies.author: @robertnicholls9917
replies.text:
If you've read his books, the analysis here should be laughable to you. 

But, this has always been our politics. The people who are truly fighting for us are the most demonized. The ones glorified can still partner with war criminals like Elliot Abrams, Kissinger and liars like Larry Summers. Even MLK had a 63% unfavorable rating. 70% of Americans thought Saddam Hussein was responsible for 9/11.

The white liberals are much easier to dupe. All you have to do is put a black face on the most horrible, right wing idea and sell it as progressive. We saw Clyburn do it, we saw Obama do it by trying to cut Social Security, making the Bush Tax Cuts permanent and pushing the TPP (NAFTA on steroids, signed by a Corporate Dem).

When a strong voice comes along and talks about the horrors of American Empire abroad and within, there is always a panel of pundits who swear to be progressive there to stop them. It's this same black bourgeoisie thinking that helped make MLK unpopular, as well as white liberals. 

It's so infuriating and disappointing to watch people who could be allies side with legislators and policies that undermine our interests. MAGAs aren't the only cult. For instance, as a leftist I tried for years to tell my liberal friends how horrible Cuomo was but to no avail. He had to hit rock bottom and cause serious damage for them to see. this same group supports Whitmer; who is undermining justice for Flint. 

I really can't understand why smart people are easily swayed into supporting the wrong people.

author: @tylerhackner9731
text: This is a fire panel!

replies.author: @sensiblegolda
replies.text:
@Tyler Hackner  None of you bothered to do your research on Dr. Cornel West. None of you bothered to look up the campaign laws. All of you are using  talking points of conservative Democrats (i.e.: Republicans). This is exactly why nothing can get done. No one running for president can come out and say I'm only going to be doing things that benefit black people. The fact that you're letting Olay, an immigrant, lead you right off the cliff, when she's not even an American, tells you how ignorant and young you still are.  dr Cornell West running as Cornell West for president 2024 is the perfect person to break up the Republican and Democrat Monopoly of our election process. No more will we be voting democrat or Republican only. 

As for your comments that Dr Cornell West is supporting somebody who sexually assaulted someone, have you heard of Donald Trump? Have you heard of Joe Biden? Both have sexual allegations against them' and Trump's been convicted civilly for his part in sexual harassment. So what is your issue with voting for Cornell West for president? Because somebody is being "accused", not convicted of sexual harassment that has nothing to do with him?  Any party that he would join the head of that party has sexual allegations against them. We're supposed to not vote for him because of that? 

Please grow up. Please do your research. How can he run for president. Below tells you how a write-in candidate or a third-party candidate registers if they run for president. I will be writing-in Dr. Cornel's West on my ballot along with hundreds of thousands of other Americans. Because Cornel West is not just for black people; he is for all people poor, poverty stricken  and the middle class. If you don't understand that then you understand nothing about the man.  We're not looking for perfection. We're looking for somebody who is decent who understands our issues and who will represent all of us, all races.

State by state shows how Cornell West will run, and hopefully wins, the presidency listed below along with the source so you can go and check it out for yourself. Stop sitting up here talking nonsense with Olay, a Republican immigrant--and if she didn't migrate to this country her elder relatives did--who does not qualify for reparations.

Source:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Write-in_candidate#:~:text=of%20draft%20campaign.-,Write%2Din%20candidates%20may%20have%20to%20register%20as%20candidates,official%20candidates%20before%20the%20election.    Accessed on: 06/11/23

UNITED STATES - The requirements to appear on the general election ballot as an independent candidate or to have write-in votes counted vary by state and by political office sought.

Forty-one states and the District of Columbia allow write-in votes on their ballots, including for president; Arkansas, New Mexico and South Carolina allow write-in candidates for some offices but not for president; Mississippi allows write-in votes only to substitute a candidate listed on the ballot who was removed, withdrew or died; Hawaii, Louisiana, Nevada, Oklahoma and South Dakota do not allow any write-in votes. Most of the jurisdictions allowing write-in votes require that the write-in candidates register by a certain date for their votes to be counted. Typically this registration consists only of a declaration of candidacy, but some states also require signatures of a certain number of voters, additional paperwork or fees. The deadline to register as a write-in candidate is usually later than to petition to be listed on the ballot.

Instead of listening to Olay, an immigrant who does not qualify for reparations, lead you all off the cliff do your homework do your research. All of you sitting up there know that Dr Cornell West cannot run a campaign for the presidency saying, "I'm only for black people in America to hell with everybody else.". Black people aren't enough to vote him in. So why would he only be just for black people?  and the majority of you young people don't even bother to vote. All y'all do is sit up there and run y'all mouth. But when it comes time to actually vote, "Oh I forgot." Oh, I'm not voting for him, he's not black enough..." Every excuse in the world. Dr. Cornell West needs people of other races to put him in; Black ain't where it's at. Y'all always want something but you don't want to do the work. You 4 sound so ignorant, but you think that you know everything. The link is a sample of the requirements for 2020 General Election. Dr. West has a very good chance of becoming the nominee or a write-in candidate even if he is not the party nominee. Grow up!

author: @DragonsEatTofu
text: My HBCU experience in the late 2010s was that Dr. Cornel West was always in ‚Äúconversation‚Äù with our other readings. Meaning that there was never a time that my professors presented him or his work to us without some grain of salt. For me he should not feel content to rest on his laurels and legacy and run for president without addressing our concerns because there is actually active skepticism of his current work in the Black community.

replies.author: @sensiblegolda
replies.text:
@olurinatti  Dr. West would be very happy to educate you. All of you sound ignorant. 

None of you bothered to do your research on Dr. Cornel West. None of you bothered to look up the campaign laws. All of you are using  talking points of conservative Democrats (i.e.: Republicans). This is exactly why nothing can get done. No one running for president can come out and say I'm only going to be doing things that benefit black people. The fact that you're letting Olay, an immigrant, lead you right off the cliff, when she's not even an American, tells you how ignorant and young you still are.  dr Cornell West running as Cornell West for president 2024 is the perfect person to break up the Republican and Democrat Monopoly of our election process. No more will we be voting democrat or Republican only. 

As for your comments that Dr Cornell West is supporting somebody who sexually assaulted someone, have you heard of Donald Trump? Have you heard of Joe Biden? Both have sexual allegations against them' and Trump's been convicted civilly for his part in sexual harassment. So what is your issue with voting for Cornell West for president? Because somebody is being "accused", not convicted of sexual harassment that has nothing to do with him?  Any party that he would join the head of that party has sexual allegations against them. We're supposed to not vote for him because of that? 

Please grow up. Please do your research. How can he run for president. Below tells you how a write-in candidate or a third-party candidate registers if they run for president. I will be writing-in Dr. Cornel's West on my ballot along with hundreds of thousands of other Americans. Because Cornel West is not just for black people; he is for all people poor, poverty stricken  and the middle class. If you don't understand that then you understand nothing about the man.  We're not looking for perfection. We're looking for somebody who is decent who understands our issues and who will represent all of us, all races.

State by state shows how Cornell West will run, and hopefully wins, the presidency listed below along with the source so you can go and check it out for yourself. Stop sitting up here talking nonsense with Olay, a Republican immigrant--and if she didn't migrate to this country her elder relatives did--who does not qualify for reparations.

Source:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Write-in_candidate#:~:text=of%20draft%20campaign.-,Write%2Din%20candidates%20may%20have%20to%20register%20as%20candidates,official%20candidates%20before%20the%20election.    Accessed on: 06/11/23

UNITED STATES - The requirements to appear on the general election ballot as an independent candidate or to have write-in votes counted vary by state and by political office sought.

Forty-one states and the District of Columbia allow write-in votes on their ballots, including for president; Arkansas, New Mexico and South Carolina allow write-in candidates for some offices but not for president; Mississippi allows write-in votes only to substitute a candidate listed on the ballot who was removed, withdrew or died; Hawaii, Louisiana, Nevada, Oklahoma and South Dakota do not allow any write-in votes. Most of the jurisdictions allowing write-in votes require that the write-in candidates register by a certain date for their votes to be counted. Typically this registration consists only of a declaration of candidacy, but some states also require signatures of a certain number of voters, additional paperwork or fees. The deadline to register as a write-in candidate is usually later than to petition to be listed on the ballot.

Instead of listening to Olay, an immigrant who does not qualify for reparations, lead you all off the cliff do your homework do your research. All of you sitting up there know that Dr Cornell West cannot run a campaign for the presidency saying, "I'm only for black people in America to hell with everybody else.". Black people aren't enough to vote him in. So why would he only be just for black people?  and the majority of you young people don't even bother to vote. All y'all do is sit up there and run y'all mouth. But when it comes time to actually vote, "Oh I forgot." Oh, I'm not voting for him, he's not black enough..." Every excuse in the world. Dr. Cornell West needs people of other races to put him in; Black ain't where it's at. Y'all always want something but you don't want to do the work. You 4 sound so ignorant, but you think that you know everything. The link is a sample of the requirements for 2020 General Election. Dr. West has a very good chance of becoming the nominee or a write-in candidate even if he is not the party nominee. Grow up!

author: @SuperAH1985
text:
100% on board with what Rebecca was saying about needing to really analyze these people once they throw their candidacy into it and 100% with Olay's point about these 3rd party candidates really need to run locally first. Why's everyone think they're able to go from academic or trash truck driver to being like, "I know, I'll be a 3rd party candidate for the U.S. presidential race." Why?! You've never even made it on the school board or city council, what makes you think both politically and strategically you can run for president, and on a 3rd party no less. Also, why does every party have so many predators on them...almost like they're really not being vetted at all. 

Great show!

7. Stay Organized

author: @BmoreAkuma
text:
My one main issue with these "vanity presidential candidates" is how once again the local level seemingly is always ignored. Even before the attempt of Congress, why not get in the "third party" in city councils to eventually build up that base? I know speaking as an unaffiliated voter in Baltimore, we had a "Green Party" candidate for the 2016 mayoral election. Joshua Harris (Green party ticket), managed to get about 10% of the popular vote and surprised a lot of folks. Later, he becomes the Vice President of the Baltimore NAACP. 

Also, another "green party" candidate in Baltimore ran for city council in Franca Muller Paz and in her district, she managed about 35% of the vote. 

 Start from the ground up and keep it moving.

author: @sarsnic
text: Also,  The People's Party is currently positioned to be on the ballot in one state, which happens to be Florida. The Green Party is going to be on the ballot in 17, and a Libertarian party will be on the ballot in 33 states. So, everything else aside, West has no logistical path to even be a spoiler.

replies.author: @namangoy
replies.text:
He can still be an effective spoiler by running a write in campaign 

But honestly I'm not worried. The only people that'll vote for him are going to be ppl that wouldn't have voted, or the MAGA Communist / Patsoc / Jimmy Dore types who would otherwise have voted for Trump/Desantis

replies.author: @sensiblegolda
replies.text:
@Kay There None of you bothered to do your research on Dr. Cornel West. None of you bothered to look up the campaign laws. All of you are using  talking points of conservative Democrats (i.e.: Republicans). This is exactly why nothing can get done. No one running for president can come out and say I'm only going to be doing things that benefit black people. The fact that you're letting Olay, an immigrant, lead you right off the cliff, when she's not even an American, tells you how ignorant and young you still are.  dr Cornell West running as Cornell West for president 2024 is the perfect person to break up the Republican and Democrat Monopoly of our election process. No more will we be voting democrat or Republican only. 

As for your comments that Dr Cornell West is supporting somebody who sexually assaulted someone, have you heard of Donald Trump? Have you heard of Joe Biden? Both have sexual allegations against them' and Trump's been convicted civilly for his part in sexual harassment. So what is your issue with voting for Cornell West for president? Because somebody is being "accused", not convicted of sexual harassment that has nothing to do with him?  Any party that he would join the head of that party has sexual allegations against them. We're supposed to not vote for him because of that? 

Please grow up. Please do your research. How can he run for president. Below tells you how a write-in candidate or a third-party candidate registers if they run for president. I will be writing-in Dr. Cornel's West on my ballot along with hundreds of thousands of other Americans. Because Cornel West is not just for black people; he is for all people poor, poverty stricken  and the middle class. If you don't understand that then you understand nothing about the man.  We're not looking for perfection. We're looking for somebody who is decent who understands our issues and who will represent all of us, all races.

State by state shows how Cornell West will run, and hopefully wins, the presidency listed below along with the source so you can go and check it out for yourself. Stop sitting up here talking nonsense with Olay, a Republican immigrant--and if she didn't migrate to this country her elder relatives did--who does not qualify for reparations.

Source:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Write-in_candidate#:~:text=of%20draft%20campaign.-,Write%2Din%20candidates%20may%20have%20to%20register%20as%20candidates,official%20candidates%20before%20the%20election.    Accessed on: 06/11/23

UNITED STATES - The requirements to appear on the general election ballot as an independent candidate or to have write-in votes counted vary by state and by political office sought.

Forty-one states and the District of Columbia allow write-in votes on their ballots, including for president; Arkansas, New Mexico and South Carolina allow write-in candidates for some offices but not for president; Mississippi allows write-in votes only to substitute a candidate listed on the ballot who was removed, withdrew or died; Hawaii, Louisiana, Nevada, Oklahoma and South Dakota do not allow any write-in votes. Most of the jurisdictions allowing write-in votes require that the write-in candidates register by a certain date for their votes to be counted. Typically this registration consists only of a declaration of candidacy, but some states also require signatures of a certain number of voters, additional paperwork or fees. The deadline to register as a write-in candidate is usually later than to petition to be listed on the ballot.

Instead of listening to Olay, an immigrant who does not qualify for reparations, lead you all off the cliff do your homework do your research. All of you sitting up there know that Dr Cornell West cannot run a campaign for the presidency saying, "I'm only for black people in America to hell with everybody else.". Black people aren't enough to vote him in. So why would he only be just for black people?  and the majority of you young people don't even bother to vote. All y'all do is sit up there and run y'all mouth. But when it comes time to actually vote, "Oh I forgot." Oh, I'm not voting for him, he's not black enough..." Every excuse in the world. Dr. Cornell West needs people of other races to put him in; Black ain't where it's at. Y'all always want something but you don't want to do the work. You 4 sound so ignorant, but you think that you know everything. The link is a sample of the requirements for 2020 General Election. Dr. West has a very good chance of becoming the nominee or a write-in candidate even if he is not the party nominee. Grow up!

author: @MichaelBrown-ti1un
text:
Dope panel. Glad this came up in my recommends. Would be here for more of these type of black-left convos, if and when you all decide to convene again. 

Ya'll talked about a lot here, but my overall takeaway: skepticism is good. Dr. West is no exception. 

Fortunately, Dr. West is now running with the Green Party, and has put some space between himself and that goofy People's Party, whom I had 0 idea about until one of its former black members talked about it during an interview on Black Power Media earlier this week.
